Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleBoard
public interface Board
Defines the contract for a game board in the Tetrix-like application

The Board interface specifies core operations for managing the game state, including brick movement, rotation, merging into the background, clearing rows, tracking score, and starting new games

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Attempts to move the current brick one row downward
      Returns:
      true if the brick was succcessfully moved down, false if blocked by collision or boundary

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Attempts to move the current brick one column to the left
      Returns:
      true if the brick was successfully moved left, false if blocked by collision or boundary

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Attempts to move the current brick one column to the right
      Returns:
      true if the brick was successfully moved right false if blocked by collision or boundary

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current brick to its next orientation
      Returns:
      true if the brick was successfully rotated, false if blocked by collision or boundary

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates and spawns a new brick at the starting position
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately collides (indicating game over), false otherwise

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Returns the current board matrix
      Returns:
      a 2D integer array representing the board state

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Returns a snapshot of the current view data
      Returns:
      a ViewData object representing the current brick and the next brick preview

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current brick into the background board matrix

      Typically called with the brick can no longer move downward

    • clearRows

      ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears any completed rows from the board
      Returns:
      a ClearRow object containing the number of rows cleared, the updated matrix, and any score bonus

    • getScore

      Score getScore()
      Returns the score tracker for the board
      Returns:
      the Score object

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets the board for a new game

      Clears the matrix, resets the score, and spawns a new brick
